clinical_study.official_title: 3D Evaluation of Postural Balance of the Adult Affected by Postural Trouble, Using EOS™ Images and 3D-reconstructions With Regard to Gravity Line.

brief_summary.textblock: Description of the geometrical configuration of the skeleton with regard to gravity line by patients suffering from spinal disorders that may induce postural troubles

detailed_description.textblock: In clinical routine, 3D analysis of postural balance is only made using clinical examination. When dealing with specific pathologies, in particular spine disorders, a better understanding of the balance could help better treat and prevent late complications. This prospective study aims at describing the pathologies of the musculoskeletal system using 3D reconstruction of the spine, the pelvis and the inferior limbs with regard to gravity line by patients suffering from postural trouble and defining new parameters to assess postural balance

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the three-dimensional geometrical configuration of the skeleton with respect to the gravity line on a large population of patient presenting a broad spectrum of pathologies inducing postural imbalance.

secondary_outcome.measure: 3D Position of the middle of acoustic meati, of each vertebral body, of the center of both acetabula and the barycentre of the four condyles with respect to the gravity line.
Morphologic and positioning parameters of the pelvis (pelvic incidence, pelvic version, sacral slope & pelvic radius)
To validate the measure of femoral and tibial torsion using EOS™ images
influence of position change on the evaluation of changes in postural balance following surgery

arm_group.description: Small group of aged healthy volunteers
Patients consulting for spine disorders that may or may not have postural troubles

intervention.description: Double Incidence Postero Anterior and Lateral full body low-dose X-ray acquisition on EOS™ device following SOP of the service of radiology.
Double Incidence Postero Anterior and Lateral full body low-dose X-ray acquisition on EOS™ device following SOP of the service of radiology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Affiliated to social insurance
- Informed of the benefits, the risks and the conduction of the study and have given their free informed consent.
For Patients
- Medical prescription for an EOS™ exam, or for Frontal AND Lateral full-spine radiographs or for a pangonogram.
For Healthy Volunteers
- 50 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
For Patients
- Patients that neither need any EOS™ exam, nor Face & Lateral full-spine radiographs, nor pangonogram.
For Healthy Volunteers
- Children or young adults (<50)
- Psychiatric or neurologic deficit.
- Anterior Surgery of Spine or inferior Member
- Chronic back pain
- Recent acute back Pain
